lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: fellowship in thee, nor thou camest not of the blood
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: royal, if thou darest not stand for ten shillings.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Well then, once in my days I'll be a madcap.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: Why, that's well said.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Well, come what will, I'll tarry at home.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: By the Lord, I'll be a traitor then, when thou art king.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I care not.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Sir John, I prithee, leave the prince and me alone:
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: I will lay him down such reasons for this adventure
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: that he shall go.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: Well, God give thee the spirit of persuasion and him
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: the ears of profiting, that what thou speakest may
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: move and what he hears may be believed, that the
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: true prince may, for recreation sake, prove a false
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: thief; for the poor abuses of the time want
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: countenance. Farewell: you shall find me in Eastcheap.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Farewell, thou latter spring! farewell, All-hallown summer!
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Now, my good sweet honey lord, ride with us
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: to-morrow: I have a jest to execute that I cannot
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: manage alone. Falstaff, Bardolph, Peto and Gadshill
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: shall rob those men that we have already waylaid:
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: yourself and I will not be there; and when they
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: have the booty, if you and I do not rob them, cut
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: this head off from my shoulders.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: How shall we part with them in setting forth?
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Why, we will set forth before or after them, and
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: appoint them a place of meeting, wherein it is at
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: our pleasure to fail, and then will they adventure
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: upon the exploit themselves; which they shall have
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: no sooner achieved, but we'll set upon them.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Yea, but 'tis like that they will know us by our
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: horses, by our habits and by every other
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: appointment, to be ourselves.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Tut! our horses they shall not see: I'll tie them
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: in the wood; our vizards we will change after we
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: leave them: and, sirrah, I have cases of buckram
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: for the nonce, to immask our noted outward garments.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Yea, but I doubt they will be too hard for us.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Well, for two of them, I know them to be as
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: true-bred cowards as ever turned back; and for the
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: third, if he fight longer than he sees reason, I'll
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: forswear arms. The virtue of this jest will be, the
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: incomprehensible lies that this same fat rogue will
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: tell us when we meet at supper: how thirty, at
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: least, he fought with; what wards, what blows, what
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: extremities he endured; and in the reproof of this
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: lies the jest.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Well, I'll go with thee: provide us all things
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: necessary and meet me to-morrow night in Eastcheap;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: there I'll sup. Farewell.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: POINS
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: Farewell, my lord.
lines.speaker: POINS

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I know you all, and will awhile uphold
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: The unyoked humour of your idleness:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Yet herein will I imitate the sun,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Who doth permit the base contagious clouds
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: To smother up his beauty from the world,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: That, when he please again to be himself,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Being wanted, he may be more wonder'd at,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: By breaking through the foul and ugly mists
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Of vapours that did seem to strangle him.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: If all the year were playing holidays,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: To sport would be as tedious as to work;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: But when they seldom come, they wish'd for come,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And nothing pleaseth but rare accidents.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: So, when this loose behavior I throw off
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And pay the debt I never promised,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: By how much better than my word I am,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: By so much shall I falsify men's hopes;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And like bright metal on a sullen ground,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: My reformation, glittering o'er my fault,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Shall show more goodly and attract more eyes
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Than that which hath no foil to set it off.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I'll so offend, to make offence a skill;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Redeeming time when men think least I will.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: My blood hath been too cold and temperate,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Unapt to stir at these indignities,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And you have found me; for accordingly
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: You tread upon my patience: but be sure
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: I will from henceforth rather be myself,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Mighty and to be fear'd, than my condition;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Which hath been smooth as oil, soft as young down,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And therefore lost that title of respect
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Which the proud soul ne'er pays but to the proud.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Our house, my sovereign liege, little deserves
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: The scourge of greatness to be used on it;
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And that same greatness too which our own hands
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Have holp to make so portly.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: My lord.--
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Worcester, get thee gone; for I do see
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Danger and disobedience in thine eye:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: O, sir, your presence is too bold and peremptory,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And majesty might never yet endure
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: The moody frontier of a servant brow.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: You have good leave to leave us: when we need
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Your use and counsel, we shall send for you.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: You were about to speak.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Yea, my good lord.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Those prisoners in your highness' name demanded,
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Which Harry Percy here at Holmedon took,
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Were, as he says, not with such strength denied
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: As is deliver'd to your majesty:
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Either envy, therefore, or misprison
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Is guilty of this fault and not my son.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: My liege, I did deny no prisoners.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But I remember, when the fight was done,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: When I was dry with rage and extreme toil,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Breathless and faint, leaning upon my sword,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Came there a certain lord, neat, and trimly dress'd,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Fresh as a bridegroom; and his chin new reap'd
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Show'd like a stubble-land at harvest-home;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He was perfumed like a milliner;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And 'twixt his finger and his thumb he held
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A pouncet-box, which ever and anon
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He gave his nose and took't away again;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Who therewith angry, when it next came there,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Took it in snuff; and still he smiled and talk'd,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And as the soldiers bore dead bodies by,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He call'd them untaught knaves, unmannerly,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To bring a slovenly unhandsome corse
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Betwixt the wind and his nobility.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: With many holiday and lady terms
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He question'd me; amongst the rest, demanded
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: My prisoners in your majesty's behalf.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I then, all smarting with my wounds being cold,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To be so pester'd with a popinjay,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Out of my grief and my impatience,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Answer'd neglectingly I know not what,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He should or he should not; for he made me mad
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To see him shine so brisk and smell so sweet
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And talk so like a waiting-gentlewoman
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of guns and drums and wounds,--God save the mark!--
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And telling me the sovereign'st thing on earth
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Was parmaceti for an inward bruise;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And that it was great pity, so it was,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: This villanous salt-petre should be digg'd
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Out of the bowels of the harmless earth,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Which many a good tall fellow had destroy'd
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: So cowardly; and but for these vile guns,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He would himself have been a soldier.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: This bald unjointed chat of his, my lord,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I answer'd indirectly, as I said;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And I beseech you, let not his report
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Come current for an accusation
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Betwixt my love and your high majesty.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: SIR WALTER BLUNT
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: The circumstance consider'd, good my lord,
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: Whate'er Lord Harry Percy then had said
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: To such a person and in such a place,
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: At such a time, with all the rest retold,
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: May reasonably die and never rise
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: To do him wrong or any way impeach
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: What then he said, so he unsay it now.
lines.speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Why, yet he doth deny his prisoners,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But with proviso and exception,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: That we at our own charge shall ransom straight
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: His brother-in-law, the foolish Mortimer;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Who, on my soul, hath wilfully betray'd
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: The lives of those that he did lead to fight
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Against that great magician, damn'd Glendower,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Whose daughter, as we hear, the Earl of March
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Hath lately married. Shall our coffers, then,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Be emptied to redeem a traitor home?
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Shall we but treason? and indent with fears,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: When they have lost and forfeited themselves?
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: No, on the barren mountains let him starve;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For I shall never hold that man my friend
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Whose tongue shall ask me for one penny cost
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To ransom home revolted Mortimer.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Revolted Mortimer!
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He never did fall off, my sovereign liege,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But by the chance of war; to prove that true
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Needs no more but one tongue for all those wounds,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Those mouthed wounds, which valiantly he took
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: When on the gentle Severn's sedgy bank,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In single opposition, hand to hand,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He did confound the best part of an hour
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In changing hardiment with great Glendower:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Three times they breathed and three times did
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: they drink,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Upon agreement, of swift Severn's flood;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Who then, affrighted with their bloody looks,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Ran fearfully among the trembling reeds,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And hid his crisp head in the hollow bank,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Bloodstained with these valiant combatants.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Never did base and rotten policy
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Colour her working with such deadly wounds;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Nor could the noble Mortimer
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Receive so many, and all willingly:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Then let not him be slander'd with revolt.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thou dost belie him, Percy, thou dost belie him;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He never did encounter with Glendower:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: I tell thee,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He durst as well have met the devil alone
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As Owen Glendower for an enemy.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Art thou not ashamed? But, sirrah, henceforth
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Let me not hear you speak of Mortimer:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Send me your prisoners with the speediest means,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Or you shall hear in such a kind from me
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As will displease you. My Lord Northumberland,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: We licence your departure with your son.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Send us your prisoners, or you will hear of it.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: An if the devil come and roar for them,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I will not send them: I will after straight
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And tell him so; for I will ease my heart,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Albeit I make a hazard of my head.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: What, drunk with choler? stay and pause awhile:
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Here comes your uncle.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Speak of Mortimer!
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'Zounds, I will speak of him; and let my soul
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Want mercy, if I do not join with him:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Yea, on his part I'll empty all these veins,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And shed my dear blood drop by drop in the dust,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But I will lift the down-trod Mortimer
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As high in the air as this unthankful king,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As this ingrate and canker'd Bolingbroke.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Brother, the king hath made your nephew mad.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Who struck this heat up after I was gone?
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He will, forsooth, have all my prisoners;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And when I urged the ransom once again
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of my wife's brother, then his cheek look'd pale,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And on my face he turn'd an eye of death,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Trembling even at the name of Mortimer.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: I cannot blame him: was not he proclaim'd
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: By Richard that dead is the next of blood?
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: He was; I heard the proclamation:
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: And then it was when the unhappy king,
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: --Whose wrongs in us God pardon!--did set forth
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: Upon his Irish expedition;
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: From whence he intercepted did return
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: To be deposed and shortly murdered.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And for whose death we in the world's wide mouth
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Live scandalized and foully spoken of.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But soft, I pray you; did King Richard then
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Proclaim my brother Edmund Mortimer
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Heir to the crown?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: NORTHUMBERLAND
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: He did; myself did hear it.
lines.speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Nay, then I cannot blame his cousin king,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That wished him on the barren mountains starve.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But shall it be that you, that set the crown
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Upon the head of this forgetful man
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And for his sake wear the detested blot
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of murderous subornation, shall it be,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That you a world of curses undergo,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Being the agents, or base second means,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The cords, the ladder, or the hangman rather?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: O, pardon me that I descend so low,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To show the line and the predicament
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Wherein you range under this subtle king;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Shall it for shame be spoken in these days,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Or fill up chronicles in time to come,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That men of your nobility and power
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Did gage them both in an unjust behalf,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As both of you--God pardon it!--have done,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To put down Richard, that sweet lovely rose,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: An plant this thorn, this canker, Bolingbroke?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And shall it in more shame be further spoken,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That you are fool'd, discarded and shook off
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: By him for whom these shames ye underwent?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: No; yet time serves wherein you may redeem

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Doth speak of you, his cheek looks pale and with

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: I cannot blame him: at my nativity
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Shaked like a coward.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: I say the earth did shake when I was born.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And I say the earth was not of my mind,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: If you suppose as fearing you it shook.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: The heavens were all on fire, the earth did tremble.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: O, then the earth shook to see the heavens on fire,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And not in fear of your nativity.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In strange eruptions; oft the teeming earth
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Is with a kind of colic pinch'd and vex'd
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: By the imprisoning of unruly wind
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Within her womb; which, for enlargement striving,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Shakes the old beldam earth and topples down
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Steeples and moss-grown towers. At your birth
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Our grandam earth, having this distemperature,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In passion shook.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Cousin, of many men

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,

lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Were strangely clamorous to the frighted fields.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: These signs have mark'd me extraordinary;
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And all the courses of my life do show
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: I am not in the roll of common men.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Where is he living, clipp'd in with the sea
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: That chides the banks of England, Scotland, Wales,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Which calls me pupil, or hath read to me?
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And bring him out that is but woman's son
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Can trace me in the tedious ways of art
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And hold me pace in deep experiments.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And I am glad of it with all my heart:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Than one of these same metre ballad-mongers;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I had rather hear a brazen canstick turn'd,

lines.value: Or a dry wheel grate on the axle-tree;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And that would set my teeth nothing on edge,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Nothing so much as mincing poetry:

lines.value: 'Tis like the forced gait of a shuffling nag.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Come, you shall have Trent turn'd.

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To any well-deserving friend;

lines.value: I'll cavil on the ninth part of a hair.

lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: The moon shines fair; you may away by night:

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Fie, cousin Percy! how you cross my father!
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I cannot choose: sometime he angers me
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: With telling me of the mouldwarp and the ant,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of the dreamer Merlin and his prophecies,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And of a dragon and a finless fish,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A clip-wing'd griffin and a moulten raven,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A couching lion and a ramping cat,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And such a deal of skimble-skamble stuff
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As puts me from my faith. I tell you what;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He held me last night at least nine hours
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In reckoning up the several devils' names
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That were his lackeys: I cried 'hum,' and 'well, go to,'
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: But mark'd him not a word. O, he is as tedious
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As a tired horse, a railing wife;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Worse than a smoky house: I had rather live
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: With cheese and garlic in a windmill, far,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Than feed on cates and have him talk to me
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In any summer-house in Christendom.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Exceedingly well read, and profited
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: In strange concealments, valiant as a lion
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: And as wondrous affable and as bountiful
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: As mines of India. Shall I tell you, cousin?
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: He holds your temper in a high respect
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: And curbs himself even of his natural scope
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: When you come 'cross his humour; faith, he does:
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: I warrant you, that man is not alive
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Might so have tempted him as you have done,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Without the taste of danger and reproof:
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: But do not use it oft, let me entreat you.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: In faith, my lord, you are too wilful-blame;
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And since your coming hither have done enough
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: To put him quite beside his patience.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: You must needs learn, lord, to amend this fault:
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Though sometimes it show greatness, courage, blood,--
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And that's the dearest grace it renders you,--
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Yet oftentimes it doth present harsh rage,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Defect of manners, want of government,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Pride, haughtiness, opinion and disdain:
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: The least of which haunting a nobleman
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Loseth men's hearts and leaves behind a stain
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Upon the beauty of all parts besides,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Beguiling them of commendation.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Well, I am school'd: good manners be your speed!
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Here come our wives, and let us take our leave.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: This is the deadly spite that angers me;
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: My wife can speak no English, I no Welsh.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: My daughter weeps: she will not part with you;
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: She'll be a soldier too, she'll to the wars.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Good father, tell her that she and my aunt Percy
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Shall follow in your conduct speedily.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: She is desperate here; a peevish self-wind harlotry,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: one that no persuasion can do good upon.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: I understand thy looks: that pretty Welsh
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Which thou pour'st down from these swelling heavens
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: I am too perfect in; and, but for shame,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: In such a parley should I answer thee.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: I understand thy kisses and thou mine,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: And that's a feeling disputation:
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: But I will never be a truant, love,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Till I have learned thy language; for thy tongue
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly penn'd,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: Sung by a fair queen in a summer's bower,
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: With ravishing division, to her lute.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Nay, if you melt, then will she run mad.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: O, I am ignorance itself in this!
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: She bids you on the wanton rushes lay you down
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And rest your gentle head upon her lap,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And she will sing the song that pleaseth you
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And on your eyelids crown the god of sleep.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Charming your blood with pleasing heaviness,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Making such difference 'twixt wake and sleep
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: As is the difference betwixt day and night
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: The hour before the heavenly-harness'd team
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Begins his golden progress in the east.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: With all my heart I'll sit and hear her sing:
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: By that time will our book, I think, be drawn
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Do so;
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And those musicians that shall play to you
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Hang in the air a thousand leagues from hence,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And straight they shall be here: sit, and attend.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Come, Kate, thou art perfect in lying down: come,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: quick, quick, that I may lay my head in thy lap.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Go, ye giddy goose.
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Now I perceive the devil understands Welsh;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And 'tis no marvel he is so humorous.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: By'r lady, he is a good musician.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Then should you be nothing but musical for you are
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: altogether governed by humours. Lie still, ye thief,
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: and hear the lady sing in Welsh.
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I had rather hear Lady, my brach, howl in Irish.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Wouldst thou have thy head broken?
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Then be still.
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Neither;'tis a woman's fault.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Now God help thee!
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To the Welsh lady's bed.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: What's that?
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Peace! she sings.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Come, Kate, I'll have your song too.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: Not mine, in good sooth.
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Not yours, in good sooth! Heart! you swear like a
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: comfit-maker's wife. 'Not you, in good sooth,' and
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'as true as I live,' and 'as God shall mend me,' and
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'as sure as day,'
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And givest such sarcenet surety for thy oaths,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: As if thou never walk'st further than Finsbury.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Swear me, Kate, like a lady as thou art,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A good mouth-filling oath, and leave 'in sooth,'
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And such protest of pepper-gingerbread,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To velvet-guards and Sunday-citizens.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Come, sing.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: LADY PERCY
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: I will not sing.
lines.speaker: LADY PERCY

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'Tis the next way to turn tailor, or be red-breast
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: teacher. An the indentures be drawn, I'll away
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: within these two hours; and so, come in when ye will.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: GLENDOWER
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: Come, come, Lord Mortimer; you are as slow
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: As hot Lord Percy is on fire to go.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: By this our book is drawn; we'll but seal,
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: And then to horse immediately.
lines.speaker: GLENDOWER

lines.value: MORTIMER
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: With all my heart.
lines.speaker: MORTIMER

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Lords, give us leave; the Prince of Wales and I
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Must have some private conference; but be near at hand,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For we shall presently have need of you.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: I know not whether God will have it so,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For some displeasing service I have done,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: That, in his secret doom, out of my blood
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He'll breed revengement and a scourge for me;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But thou dost in thy passages of life
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Make me believe that thou art only mark'd
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For the hot vengeance and the rod of heaven
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To punish my mistreadings. Tell me else,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Could such inordinate and low desires,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Such poor, such bare, such lewd, such mean attempts,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Such barren pleasures, rude society,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As thou art match'd withal and grafted to,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Accompany the greatness of thy blood
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And hold their level with thy princely heart?
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: So please your majesty, I would I could
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Quit all offences with as clear excuse
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: As well as I am doubtless I can purge
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Myself of many I am charged withal:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Yet such extenuation let me beg,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: As, in reproof of many tales devised,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: which oft the ear of greatness needs must hear,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: By smiling pick-thanks and base news-mongers,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I may, for some things true, wherein my youth
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Hath faulty wander'd and irregular,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Find pardon on my true submission.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: God pardon thee! yet let me wonder, Harry,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: At thy affections, which do hold a wing
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Quite from the flight of all thy ancestors.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thy place in council thou hast rudely lost.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Which by thy younger brother is supplied,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And art almost an alien to the hearts
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Of all the court and princes of my blood:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: The hope and expectation of thy time
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Is ruin'd, and the soul of every man
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Prophetically doth forethink thy fall.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Had I so lavish of my presence been,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: So common-hackney'd in the eyes of men,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: So stale and cheap to vulgar company,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Opinion, that did help me to the crown,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Had still kept loyal to possession
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And left me in reputeless banishment,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: A fellow of no mark nor likelihood.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: By being seldom seen, I could not stir
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But like a comet I was wonder'd at;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: That men would tell their children 'This is he;'
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Others would say 'Where, which is Bolingbroke?'
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And then I stole all courtesy from heaven,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And dress'd myself in such humility
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: That I did pluck allegiance from men's hearts,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Loud shouts and salutations from their mouths,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Even in the presence of the crowned king.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thus did I keep my person fresh and new;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: My presence, like a robe pontifical,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Ne'er seen but wonder'd at: and so my state,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Seldom but sumptuous, showed like a feast
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And won by rareness such solemnity.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: The skipping king, he ambled up and down
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: With shallow jesters and rash bavin wits,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Soon kindled and soon burnt; carded his state,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Mingled his royalty with capering fools,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Had his great name profaned with their scorns
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And gave his countenance, against his name,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To laugh at gibing boys and stand the push
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Of every beardless vain comparative,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Grew a companion to the common streets,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Enfeoff'd himself to popularity;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: That, being daily swallow'd by men's eyes,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: They surfeited with honey and began
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To loathe the taste of sweetness, whereof a little
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: More than a little is by much too much.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: So when he had occasion to be seen,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He was but as the cuckoo is in June,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Heard, not regarded; seen, but with such eyes
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As, sick and blunted with community,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Afford no extraordinary gaze,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Such as is bent on sun-like majesty
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: When it shines seldom in admiring eyes;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But rather drowzed and hung their eyelids down,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Slept in his face and render'd such aspect
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As cloudy men use to their adversaries,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Being with his presence glutted, gorged and full.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And in that very line, Harry, standest thou;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For thou has lost thy princely privilege
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: With vile participation: not an eye
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But is a-weary of thy common sight,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Save mine, which hath desired to see thee more;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Which now doth that I would not have it do,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Make blind itself with foolish tenderness.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I shall hereafter, my thrice gracious lord,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Be more myself.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For all the world
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: As thou art to this hour was Richard then
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: When I from France set foot at Ravenspurgh,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And even as I was then is Percy now.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Now, by my sceptre and my soul to boot,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He hath more worthy interest to the state
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Than thou the shadow of succession;
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: For of no right, nor colour like to right,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: He doth fill fields with harness in the realm,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Turns head against the lion's armed jaws,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And, being no more in debt to years than thou,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Leads ancient lords and reverend bishops on
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To bloody battles and to bruising arms.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: What never-dying honour hath he got
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Against renowned Douglas! whose high deeds,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Whose hot incursions and great name in arms
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Holds from all soldiers chief majority
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And military title capital
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Through all the kingdoms that acknowledge Christ:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thrice hath this Hotspur, Mars in swathling clothes,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: This infant warrior, in his enterprises
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Discomfited great Douglas, ta'en him once,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Enlarged him and made a friend of him,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To fill the mouth of deep defiance up
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And shake the peace and safety of our throne.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: And what say you to this? Percy, Northumberland,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: The Archbishop's grace of York, Douglas, Mortimer,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Capitulate against us and are up.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: But wherefore do I tell these news to thee?
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Why, Harry, do I tell thee of my foes,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Which art my near'st and dearest enemy?
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thou that art like enough, through vassal fear,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Base inclination and the start of spleen
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To fight against me under Percy's pay,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To dog his heels and curtsy at his frowns,
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: To show how much thou art degenerate.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: PRINCE HENRY
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Do not think so; you shall not find it so:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And God forgive them that so much have sway'd
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Your majesty's good thoughts away from me!
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I will redeem all this on Percy's head
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And in the closing of some glorious day
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Be bold to tell you that I am your son;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: When I will wear a garment all of blood
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And stain my favours in a bloody mask,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Which, wash'd away, shall scour my shame with it:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And that shall be the day, whene'er it lights,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: That this same child of honour and renown,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: This gallant Hotspur, this all-praised knight,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And your unthought-of Harry chance to meet.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: For every honour sitting on his helm,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Would they were multitudes, and on my head
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: My shames redoubled! for the time will come,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: That I shall make this northern youth exchange
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: His glorious deeds for my indignities.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Percy is but my factor, good my lord,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: To engross up glorious deeds on my behalf;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And I will call him to so strict account,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: That he shall render every glory up,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Yea, even the slightest worship of his time,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Or I will tear the reckoning from his heart.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: This, in the name of God, I promise here:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: The which if He be pleased I shall perform,
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: I do beseech your majesty may salve
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: The long-grown wounds of my intemperance:
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: If not, the end of life cancels all bands;
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: And I will die a hundred thousand deaths
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: Ere break the smallest parcel of this vow.
lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: KING HENRY IV
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: A hundred thousand rebels die in this:
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Thou shalt have charge and sovereign trust herein.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: How now, good Blunt? thy looks are full of speed.
lines.speaker: KING HENRY IV

lines.value: Nay, task me to my word; approve me, lord.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF DOUGLAS
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Thou art the king of honour:
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: No man so potent breathes upon the ground
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: But I will beard him.
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Do so, and 'tis well.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: What letters hast thou there?--I can but thank you.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: These letters come from your father.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Letters from him! why comes he not himself?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: He cannot come, my lord; he is grievous sick.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'Zounds! how has he the leisure to be sick
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: In such a rustling time? Who leads his power?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Under whose government come they along?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: His letters bear his mind, not I, my lord.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: I prithee, tell me, doth he keep his bed?
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: He did, my lord, four days ere I set forth;
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: And at the time of my departure thence
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: He was much fear'd by his physicians.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: I would the state of time had first been whole
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Ere he by sickness had been visited:
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: His health was never better worth than now.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Sick now! droop now! this sickness doth infect
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The very life-blood of our enterprise;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: 'Tis catching hither, even to our camp.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He writes me here, that inward sickness--
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And that his friends by deputation could not
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: So soon be drawn, nor did he think it meet
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To lay so dangerous and dear a trust
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: On any soul removed but on his own.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Yet doth he give us bold advertisement,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: That with our small conjunction we should on,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To see how fortune is disposed to us;
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: For, as he writes, there is no quailing now.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Because the king is certainly possess'd
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of all our purposes. What say you to it?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Your father's sickness is a maim to us.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A perilous gash, a very limb lopp'd off:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And yet, in faith, it is not; his present want
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Seems more than we shall find it: were it good
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To set the exact wealth of all our states
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: All at one cast? to set so rich a main
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: On the nice hazard of one doubtful hour?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: It were not good; for therein should we read
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The very bottom and the soul of hope,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The very list, the very utmost bound
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Of all our fortunes.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF DOUGLAS
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: 'Faith, and so we should;
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Where now remains a sweet reversion:
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: We may boldly spend upon the hope of what
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Is to come in:
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: A comfort of retirement lives in this.
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A rendezvous, a home to fly unto.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: If that the devil and mischance look big
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Upon the maidenhead of our affairs.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF WORCESTER
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: But yet I would your father had been here.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: The quality and hair of our attempt
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Brooks no division: it will be thought
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: By some, that know not why he is away,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: That wisdom, loyalty and mere dislike
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Of our proceedings kept the earl from hence:
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And think how such an apprehension
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: May turn the tide of fearful faction
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And breed a kind of question in our cause;
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: For well you know we of the offering side
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Must keep aloof from strict arbitrement,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: And stop all sight-holes, every loop from whence
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: The eye of reason may pry in upon us:
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: This absence of your father's draws a curtain,
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: That shows the ignorant a kind of fear
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: Before not dreamt of.
lines.speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: You strain too far.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: I rather of his absence make this use:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: It lends a lustre and more great opinion,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: A larger dare to our great enterprise,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Than if the earl were here; for men must think,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: If we without his help can make a head
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To push against a kingdom, with his help
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: We shall o'erturn it topsy-turvy down.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Yet all goes well, yet all our joints are whole.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF DOUGLAS
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: As heart can think: there is not such a word
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Spoke of in Scotland as this term of fear.
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: My cousin Vernon, welcome, by my soul.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: VERNON
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Pray God my news be worth a welcome, lord.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: The Earl of Westmoreland, seven thousand strong,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Is marching hitherwards; with him Prince John.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: No harm: what more?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: VERNON
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: And further, I have learn'd,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: The king himself in person is set forth,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Or hitherwards intended speedily,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: With strong and mighty preparation.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: He shall be welcome too. Where is his son,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The nimble-footed madcap Prince of Wales,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And his comrades, that daff'd the world aside,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And bid it pass?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: VERNON
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: All furnish'd, all in arms;
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: All plumed like estridges that with the wind
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Baited like eagles having lately bathed;
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Glittering in golden coats, like images;
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: As full of spirit as the month of May,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: And gorgeous as the sun at midsummer;
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Wanton as youthful goats, wild as young bulls.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: I saw young Harry, with his beaver on,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: His cuisses on his thighs, gallantly arm'd
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: Rise from the ground like feather'd Mercury,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: And vaulted with such ease into his seat,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: As if an angel dropp'd down from the clouds,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: To turn and wind a fiery Pegasus
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: And witch the world with noble horsemanship.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: No more, no more: worse than the sun in March,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: This praise doth nourish agues. Let them come:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: They come like sacrifices in their trim,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And to the fire-eyed maid of smoky war
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: All hot and bleeding will we offer them:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The mailed Mars shall on his altar sit
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Up to the ears in blood. I am on fire
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: To hear this rich reprisal is so nigh
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: And yet not ours. Come, let me taste my horse,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Who is to bear me like a thunderbolt
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Against the bosom of the Prince of Wales:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Harry to Harry shall, hot horse to horse,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Meet and ne'er part till one drop down a corse.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: O that Glendower were come!
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: VERNON
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: There is more news:
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: I learn'd in Worcester, as I rode along,
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: He cannot draw his power this fourteen days.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: EARL OF DOUGLAS
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: That's the worst tidings that I hear of yet.
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: WORCESTER
lines.speaker: WORCESTER

lines.value: Ay, by my faith, that bears a frosty sound.
lines.speaker: WORCESTER

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: What may the king's whole battle reach unto?
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: VERNON
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: To thirty thousand.
lines.speaker: VERNON

lines.value: HOTSPUR
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Forty let it be:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: My father and Glendower being both away,
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: The powers of us may serve so great a day
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Come, let us take a muster speedily:
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: Doomsday is near; die all, die merrily.
lines.speaker: HOTSPUR

lines.value: EARL OF DOUGLAS
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Talk not of dying: I am out of fear
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: Of death or death's hand for this one-half year.
lines.speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: Bardolph, get thee before to Coventry; fill me a
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: bottle of sack: our soldiers shall march through;
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: we'll to Sutton Co'fil' tonight.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: BARDOLPH
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: Will you give me money, captain?
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: Lay out, lay out.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: BARDOLPH
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: This bottle makes an angel.
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: An if it do, take it for thy labour; and if it make
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: twenty, take them all; I'll answer the coinage. Bid
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: my lieutenant Peto meet me at town's end.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: BARDOLPH
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: I will, captain: farewell.
lines.speaker: BARDOLPH

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: If I be not ashamed of my soldiers, I am a soused
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: gurnet. I have misused the king's press damnably.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: I have got, in exchange of a hundred and fifty
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: soldiers, three hundred and odd pounds. I press me
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: none but good house-holders, yeoman's sons; inquire
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: me out contracted bachelors, such as had been asked
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: twice on the banns; such a commodity of warm slaves,
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: as had as lieve hear the devil as a drum; such as
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: fear the report of a caliver worse than a struck
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: fowl or a hurt wild-duck. I pressed me none but such
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: toasts-and-butter, with hearts in their bellies no
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: bigger than pins' heads, and they have bought out
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: their services; and now my whole charge consists of
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: ancients, corporals, lieutenants, gentlemen of
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: companies, slaves as ragged as Lazarus in the
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: painted cloth, where the glutton's dogs licked his
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: sores; and such as indeed were never soldiers, but
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: discarded unjust serving-men, younger sons to
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: younger brothers, revolted tapsters and ostlers
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: trade-fallen, the cankers of a calm world and a
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: long peace, ten times more dishonourable ragged than
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: an old faced ancient: and such have I, to fill up
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: the rooms of them that have bought out their
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: services, that you would think that I had a hundred
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: and fifty tattered prodigals lately come from
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: swine-keeping, from eating draff and husks. A mad
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: fellow met me on the way and told me I had unloaded
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: all the gibbets and pressed the dead bodies. No eye
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: hath seen such scarecrows. I'll not march through
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: Coventry with them, that's flat: nay, and the
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: villains march wide betwixt the legs, as if they had
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: gyves on; for indeed I had the most of them out of
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: prison. There's but a shirt and a half in all my
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: company; and the half shirt is two napkins tacked
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: together and thrown over the shoulders like an
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: herald's coat without sleeves; and the shirt, to say
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: the truth, stolen from my host at Saint Alban's, or
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: the red-nose innkeeper of Daventry. But that's all
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: one; they'll find linen enough on every hedge.
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: cry you mercy: I thought your honour had already been

lines.value: at Shrewsbury.

lines.speaker: WESTMORELAND

lines.value: away all night.

lines.value: steal cream.

lines.value: fellows are these that come after?

lines.value: Mine, Hal, mine.

lines.speaker: PRINCE HENRY

lines.value: FALSTAFF
lines.speaker: FALSTAFF

lines.value: for powder; they'll fill a pit as well as better:

lines.value: tush, man, mortal men, mortal men.

lines.speaker: VERNON
